column4: Hi, I'm using Ubuntu 11.04 and I have a problem. When I run a speedtest my connection speed averages above 1 Mega / sec regardless of server. When I try loading a webpage via any browser, it takes super long for any website to load. About 20-30 seconds for an average website. Any ideas why? On Windows everything works perfectly
try a differnet browser
via any browser
sorry i skim-read
hehe np :)
can you use terminal if so try pinging google.com
about 30-35 ms
what about downloading something with wget? is it slow?
I will try it out. Don't know what to download with wget
just try a webpage like ubuntus homepage
I tried the ubuntu homepage, it took pretty long
about 10-13 seconds
and the speed that is displayed is 200 KB/ s
it sits a long time on the Resolving www.ubuntu.com...   part
and in the browser it gets stuck on the "Waiting for http://foo.bar" parts
any ideas aeon-ltd, robin0800?
try disabling ipv6
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WebBrowsingSlowIPv6IPv4
entirely, or for a specific browser?
entirely
It seems I dont have it enabled at all, since lsmod | grep ipv6 doesn't return a thing
